question: 49ers vs. Jets
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for September 9 at 8:20 PM ET:

If the San Francisco 49ers win, the market will resolve to “49ers”.

If the New York Jets win, the market will resolve to “Jets”.

 If the game is not completed by September 16, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Trump say a slur during the debate?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump uses a slur targeting race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexuality, or disabilities at least once during the first presidential debate between himself and Kamala Harris during the 2024 election cycle. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For this market to resolve to "Yes" Trump must clearly be using the term in reference to the derogatory meaning of a word in question (e.g. If Trump says "I ate too many crackers" this would not qualify).

If no debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump takes place before election day, this market will resolve to "50-50".

The resolution source is live video of the debate. In case of ambiguity, an official transcript and/or a consensus of credible reporting may also be considered.

question: Kamala positive favorability by Friday?
description:
This is a market will resolve to “Yes”, if Kamala Harris's favorable rating by FiveThirtyEight is higher than her unfavorable rating for any day between September 9 (inclusive) and September 13, 2024 (inclusive). Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

Harris's favorable rating must be higher than her unfavorable rating, ties will not qualify.

The favorability ratings for each day must be finalized before they are considered for this market (namely once the next data point is available, the previous one is finalized).

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's rating poll aggregator, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/favorability/kamala-harris/, specifically the favorability rating indicated by the purple "favorable" trend line for the resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates the favorability rating will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market may only resolve to "No" once the first data point after September 13, 2024 is published. If no such data point is available by September 20, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

Please note the resolution source reports the rating value to only one decimal point (e.g. 42.8%, 33.9%, etc). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market.

question: Will Trump say "Springfield" at debate?
description:
Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are currently scheduled to debate on September 10 in an event hosted by ABC News. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump says "Springfield" at any point during the first presidential debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump in the 2024 election cycle. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "Springfield" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the US city Springfield, Ohio.

If no such debate in the 2024 election cycle happens by November 4, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or if either candidate drops out of the race, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the debate.

events.title: What will Trump say at the debate?
events.description: This is a market group over what Donald Trump will say at his debate with Kamala Harris scheduled for September 10, 2024.

question: Will Playboi Carti release new album by Friday?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Playboi Carti officially releases a new album between September 8 and September 13, 2024, 11:59 PM PT (Los Angeles time). Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

Officially released means that a newly released album is officially available for download or streaming (not including live events) by the resolution date.

The resolution source will be any official  Playboi Carti streaming or download site, e.g. Apple Music or Spotify.

question: Berachain airdrop by September 30?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Berachain launches a token and announces they have performed an airdrop between September 8 and September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market "locked" tokens or non-swappable tokens will not suffice to resolve this market to "Yes".

The primary resolution source for this market is on-chain information and official information from the Berachain team, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: ESPN back on DirecTV before Falcons vs. Eagles?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if ESPN becomes available on DirecTV again between September 8, 2024, 11:00 AM ET and the beginning of Falcons vs. Eagles (currently scheduled to begin on September 16, 8:15 PM ET). Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If an agreement is announced that ESPN will be available again on DirecTV before the start of Falcons vs. Eagles, it will qualify for a "Yes" resolution only if ESPN is broadly back for most DirecTV customers before the game - if the agreement goes into effect after the beginning of the game, it will resolve to "No".

The beginning of the game is defined as when the first snap occurs.

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from The Walt Disney Company, DirecTV, LLC, and/or their subsidiaries, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

The beginning of the game is defined as when the first snap occurs.

The primary resolution source for this market will be information from The Walt Disney Company, DirecTV, LLC, and/or their subsidiaries, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Trump sell shares of DJT in September?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if it is confirmed that Donald Trump has sold any of his shares in Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise this market will resolve to "No".

If filings for a sale are made public or Trump otherwise announces a sale of shares in DJT by this market's resolution date, this will qualify for a "Yes" resolution even if the actual sale is yet to occur.

The primary resolution source will be public filings however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

If it is a mathematical certainty West Ham United will win, this market will immediately resolve to “Yes.” Likewise, if it becomes mathematically impossible for West Ham United to win, this market will immediately resolve to “No.” Potential retroactive points deductions past these points will have no bearing on this market’s resolution.

events.title: Premier League Winner
events.description: This is a market on who will win the Premier League in the 2024-25 season.

question: Will the 49ers win by 5 or more points?
description:
This market refers to the NFL Week 1 Regular Season matchup between the San Francisco 49ers and the New York Jets scheduled for 8:15 PM ET, September 9, 2024.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the San Francisco 49ers win their game against the New York Jets by 5 or more points.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.”

If this game is postponed after September 16, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or canceled, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: MNF: 49ers vs. Jets
events.description: This is a market on the outcome of the Monday Night Football game between the San Francisco 49ers and the New York Jets.

question: Will there be 44 or more combined points scored?
description:
This market refers to the NFL Week 1 Regular Season matchup between the San Francisco 49ers and the New York Jets scheduled for 8:15 PM ET, September 9, 2024.

If the combined total points scored by the San Francisco 49ers and the New York Jets is 44 or more, this market will resolve to “Yes.” If it is less than 44, this market will resolve to “No.”

If this game is postponed after September 16, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or canceled, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: MNF: 49ers vs. Jets
events.description: This is a market on the outcome of the Monday Night Football game between the San Francisco 49ers and the New York Jets.

question: Will 'Joker: Folie à Deux' gross less than $105m opening weekend?
description:
This is a market on how much 'Joker: Folie à Deux' (2024) will gross domestically on its opening weekend. The “Domestic Weekend” tab on https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt11315808/ will be used to resolve this market once the values for the 3-day opening weekend (October 4 - 6) are final (i.e. not studio estimates).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if 'Joker: Folie à Deux' (2024) grosses less than $105,000,000 on its 3-day opening weekend. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Please note, this market will resolve according to the Box Office Mojo numbers under Domestic Weekend for the 3-day weekend (which typically includes Thursday's previews), regardless of whether domestic refers to only the USA, or to USA and Canada, etc.

If there is no final data available by October 14, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, another credible resolution source will be chosen.

events.title: 'Joker: Folie à Deux' Opening Weekend Box Office
events.description: This is a market over the domestic opening weekend box office figures for 'Joker: Folie à Deux'.

question: Will the Debate finish by 10:30 PM?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the ABC-hosted presidential debate scheduled for September 10, 2024, concludes by 10:30:59 PM ET (inclusive). If the debate is still ongoing at 10:31:00 PM ET or later this market will resolve to "No". 

If no Presidential debate takes place on September 10 ET, this market will resolve to "No". 

The debate will be considered to have ended at the moment when both candidates have finished speaking for the final time during the official broadcast.

If the debate is broadcast on a delay or does not match real-time events, the official broadcast timing will be used to resolve this market.

The resolution source will be the main ABC broadcast of the debate.

question: Will Tyreek Hill sue the cops?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Tyreek Hill either files a lawsuit or formally presses criminal charges against any police officer or the police department involved in his September 8 detainment by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No."

An an announcement from Tyreek Hill that he will take legal action in the future will NOT alone qualify for a "Yes" resolution, legal action must actually be taken. 

The primary resolution source will be court filings and information from Tyreek Hill or one of his legal representatives, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.
